lessons.title: Introduction to Python
description: Python is an Object oriented, interpreted dynamic programming language. It allows users to write fewer lines of code compared to other programming languages like C++ and Java.
Lets interact with the python compiler by using the ‘print’ command. The print command will output any given value to the user.
lessons.question: Using the print function, print out 'hello world' on the console
lessons.hints: print 'hello' will print hello string on the console

lessons.title: Python Variables
description: Variables are entities that store data. We use variables to store all kinds of data and perform operations on them. Python variables do not require any type declaration.
lessons.question: Create a variable named test. Give it a value 10 and then print it
lessons.hints: Declare a by giving it a name and a value

lessons.title: Introduction to Javascript
description: An introduction to web programming and JavaScript
